pullRequest.body:
Remove some now-addressed porting notes; re-instate a few more lemmas which were formerly marked as simp.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [67928ad413](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15875/commits/67928ad41360fc664bcddb2239eee39749b2a39e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
@mattrobball what does your keying tool say about these `simp` lemmas? If you point me to it, I can check myself.
`#discr_tree_simp_key my_lemma`
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/883a07af-3cc3-4226-91be-be004fc8c263) for commit 67928ad41360fc664bcddb2239eee39749b2a39e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2638d3d4-28ba-44e2-ae70-41e168a39ad4/to/883a07af-3cc3-4226-91be-be004fc8c263) against commit 07a0ae9126dff1d2838a59b03ac6763e22ed6cb4.
If we wanted to, we could still scope them to `intervalIntegral`, although in that case, it would be nice if there were a comment in the docstring for each lemma.

Since `intervalIntegral` is the head symbol, the discrimination tree already effectively does the scoping. The main issue is that it doesn't see anything beyond that head symbol for the most part. I think these are ok for now because the domain is pretty small. It will probably be fine indefinitely.
I do not have a strong opinion about the newly marked simp lemmas: I am happy to also just remove the porting note.
@mattrobball Feel free to suggest what would be the better course of action.
I think just merging is fine.
bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10462199123/job/28972017254)

bors r-

bors d+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
One of the runners ran out of space (and I've temporarily removed it from the pool), so re-running this should work. I'm not sure if there's another reason this was given `bors r-` though.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10464929290/job/28979309858)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10464929290/job/28979310177)
I went through a couple and the keys aren't great for the context.
I went through a couple and the keys aren't great for the context.
`@intervalIntegral _ _ _ <other> _ _ (@volume ‚Ñù _)`
Looks like it applies to any integral.
`@HSMul.hSMul ‚Ñù _ _ _ _ (@intervalIntegral _ _ _ <other> _ _ (@volume ‚Ñù _))`
Slightly better.
`@intervalIntegral _ _ _ <other> _ _ (@volume ‚Ñù _)`
Any integral
`@HSMul.hSMul ‚Ñù _ _ _ _ (@intervalIntegral _ _ _ <other> _ _ (@volume ‚Ñù _))`
`@intervalIntegral _ _ _ <other> _ _ (@volume ‚Ñù _)`
Any integral

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(SpecialFunctions): re-instate many simp lemmas

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
@mattrobball what does your keying tool say about these `simp` lemmas? If you point me to it, I can check myself.
`#discr_tree_simp_key my_lemma`
I went through a couple and the keys aren't great for the context.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/883a07af-3cc3-4226-91be-be004fc8c263) for commit 67928ad41360fc664bcddb2239eee39749b2a39e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2638d3d4-28ba-44e2-ae70-41e168a39ad4/to/883a07af-3cc3-4226-91be-be004fc8c263) against commit 07a0ae9126dff1d2838a59b03ac6763e22ed6cb4.
If we wanted to, we could still scope them to `intervalIntegral`, although in that case, it would be nice if there were a comment in the docstring for each lemma.

Since `intervalIntegral` is the head symbol, the discrimination tree already effectively does the scoping. The main issue is that it doesn't see anything beyond that head symbol for the most part. I think these are ok for now because the domain is pretty small. It will probably be fine indefinitely.
I do not have a strong opinion about the newly marked simp lemmas: I am happy to also just remove the porting note.
@mattrobball Feel free to suggest what would be the better course of action.
I think just merging is fine.
bors merge
